intro: Erigeron chelanensis, commonly known as the Chelan fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Northwest of the United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. It features hairy, narrow leaves and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Erigeron chelanensis is often found in areas with high humidity and is adapted to thrive in temperate climates.
